pr_title: Specify flex as StreetMode instead of TransportMode

timeline.message: Specify flex as StreetMode instead of TransportMode
Only add the earliest itinerary per trip for direct flex
Only add the earliest itinerary per trip for direct flex
Set default RequestModes to access/egress/direct walk
Do not return TripTimesShort from flexible Legs

timeline.author: gmellemstrand

replies.bodyText: Document that the reference to flexibleTrip is lost at this point
replies.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.bodyText: Check for otpFeature flexible (also in other places in the code)
timeline.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.message: Rename flexible to flexibleTrip and document
Add checks if OTPFeature flexRouting is on
Change flex access/egress/direct to be qualified modes in rest api

timeline.bodyText: List.of() is preferred instead of Collections.emptyList()
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: The routeTransit should give an overview of the transit routing - and delegate as much of the business logic as possible - the FLEX now complicate to main logic a lot and if we introduced another similar concept then it would become hard to understand. Also, people who do not care about FLEX should be able to skip all flex code. The new code in this method is not at the same abstraction level and it need to refactored out. Some of it should maybe be pushed to other classes and some into methods in this class. Enums are compared by equals. Also, the flow is very hard to follow, the check on mode is/is not FLEX is probably a business concept (not DRY) witch should have a name.
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText:
I have refactored out some of the access/egress logic for flex. I had to duplicate some code, as the flex access/egress search requires a regular access/egress search as input. It might be that a few lines of duplicated code is better than combining the logic for flex access/egress and regular access/egress.
I still does look somewhat complicated, because you need to perform a check on access and egress separately, to see if you should use the flex logic or the regular logic. Still, it is more readable than what it was before.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.bodyText: accessTransfers is not a good name, maybe accessListTransit or accessToTransit ?
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: I have renamed them to accessList and egressList, but it is hard to find a name that fits.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.message: Separate flex access/egress routing more from the rest of the routing code
Change order of modes in built-in client and update translations again
Add javadoc to Qualifier, remove unused import

timeline.bodyText: Below there is some code that is commented out, should that be deleted or is this just a temporary guard, in witch case there should probably be a comment here telling why we can retrieve this info on a FLEX trip.
timeline.author: t2gran

replies.bodyText: This is used to retrieve information to populate the estimateCall for to/from place. We have to decide if the EstimatedCallType is applicable to flexible trips. I can add a comment about it.
replies.author: gmellemstrand

timeline.bodyText: This is redundant, the field is public
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: These 2 parameters are passed inn with the request in several places, if we move them to the request they no longer need to be passed in. This would also make these parameters configurable.
timeline.author: t2gran

timeline.bodyText: Ask @hannesj Why FlexTrip does not extend Trip
timeline.author: gmellemstrand

replies.bodyText: I had a discussion with Hannes about this, and he agreed that it would probably be a good idea to have FlexTrip extend Trip. It is not quite straightforward, so we can handle it in another PR.
replies.author: gmellemstrand
